newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rebels say lost 140 fighters in raid.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rebels say lost 140 fighters in raid.

text.p: Sri Lanka's Tamil Tiger rebels on Saturday said they had lost 140 fighters, including 78 women, in a raid this week on army positions in the north.
Rebel Voice of Tigers radio, monitored by Reuters, said the Tigers destroyed 11 artillery pieces and an ammunition dump during the raid on the Paranthan army base on Thursday.
The government has said 250 Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) rebels died in the attack in which 142 army soldiers were killed and 232 were wounded.

The army said its troops destroyed the artillery pieces and ammunition dump themselves to prevent them falling into rebel hands after the Tigers breached army defences in a human-wave attack early on Thursday.
Rebel radio said the LTTE had captured three 120mm mortars, three heavy machine guns, rifles, artillery shells and a large stock of ammunition as well as night vision goggles.
The rebels are fighting for independence in the north and east of Sri Lanka.
